review: I  had great hopes for Apple TV but no such luck. To start off if you want to use the remote you hands better be the size of ten year old, so useless for me. This by itself makes the device unusable, but there are other problems, I have wireless extender so I can get a signal in my back yard. Well at some points in my house you get both signals, if your Iphone is not on the same network the Apple TV, you are out of luck. You have to stop and change to the same network. So do buy if you have mulitple networks in your house. The media choices are pretty limited, so unless you plan on spending a lot of money at the Itunes store you are out of luck.All I wanted was a device that would project my Iphone to my TV. I think I will just hook up a PC and get a wireless keyboard and mouse.

review: A small, simple (we old folks like simple), easy to use device that greatly enhances the utility of our TV.We are great fans of PBS, and Netflix subscribers.  Having the ability to access both thru our TV is very convenient, instead of trying to watch content on our iPads or sit in front of the computer.  We are not constrained to watch only what PBS is showing at the moment; we can watch the current programming at our convenience and access programs that we have missed.  I also like the ability to access my iTunes music library and play music thru the TV.  No doubt there are other features that I haven't discovered yet.I combined the Apple TV with a 5-port HDMI switch to simplify the setup and allow multiple devices to be played thru the TV without the need to change cables due the limited number of HDMI ports. The combination has greatly enhanced the simplicity of operation and our enjoyment of our entertainment system.
